data.title: Sometimes it's the staff and not the room
data.text: This hotel is an older Drury and while the rooms were clean they were not as nice as the newer hotels. The bathroom is very small. But, the beds were comfortable and the staff exceptionally polite. I would take a kind staff over a large bathroom any day.

data.title: Clean, comfy, and convenient!
data.text: In town for a week, working in Centennial.  The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to the highway.  There is a Walgreens close by for picking up those quick items.  It was just a short drive to shops and restaurants!  The hotel is certainly not new and although the decor is somewhat plain, the room was very clean and comfortable!  Breakfast in the morning was pretty standard for a hotel but the hot snacks, popcorn and drinks in the evening was a very nice add.  I stayed in a king suite which had a desk for working!  There is also a nice view to the west!    My only critique would be that the air conditioner didn't quite cool all the way to the bedroom, making it somewhat an uneven temperature.  If you need a comfortable place to stay.....this one could be for you!  I would definitely stay here again!

data.title: Good location and comfy bed
data.text: This location was perfect for our needs, visiting our son and touring. The check-in and check-out was very efficient. Breakfast was good, although the somewhat late start time of 7 A.M. on weekends is questionable. We enjoyed their kick-back special the night we arrived and it was up to Drury Inn standards. Our room was nice and the bed was comfy. The shower head was great as was the Wi-Fi. Their hot tub was low on water the night I used it.

data.title: Awesome hotel and staff!
data.text:
After a long day of working and traveling we arrived in Denver. Our first hotel was horrible and we had to find another at 12:30 in the morning!  

Evan was awesome! Our room was nice and clean. We left the next morning to continue our travels. The assistant manager was super nice and helpful as well. She gave us tips on places that were a must see while visiting Colorado. I wish I could remember her name! I do know she is from Utah!  

This is an awesome hotel.

data.title: Amazing Staff!
data.text: The staff was incredible! The room was very nice, and the hotel was kept very well. The pool was comforting and so was the hot tub! The shower and soaps were so great I wanted to take them home with me!

data.title: A litte disappointed with the room
data.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a road-trip in CO. The staff at reception was very nice. The room was disappointing especially since we stayed the previous night at another Drury in Colorado Springs. We booked a "deluxe queen suite". It was just a double queen room and it was a little cramped. The lobby was nice and seemed remodeled. I have noticed that other travelers remarked about the small breakfast/afternoon area. It was quite cramped especially on our first night there. I believe they were fully booked at that time and had a least one busload. But were very efficient during check-in. The afternoon kick-back was nice too.

data.title: Kickback Surprise
data.text: We enjoyed our stay and had beautiful and spacious rooms.  We appreciated the guest laundry as we had been travelling for quite awhile.  Along with a good breakfast selection, we were surprised with the Kickback Card.  It entitled us to an evening meal plus drinks.  The selections were always good!  The divided pool was partly outdoors and partly indoors.  I also enjoyed the landscape art work that decorated the hotel.

data.title: Good
data.text: Ok. So I have stayed at Drury hotels and love the amenities. Had to come to Denver for a conference and stayed here. All was good except for one experience. I stayed 4 nights and only the last night did I arrive at 7p to take advantage of a free drink. The lady working the bar told me she was closed. My phone said 7:01pm and her cart was half full taking the bar down. I was denied my free drinks. I didn't even want food as I picked up some local food. Just wanted a drink with my dinner. So be careful to arrive before 6:59p or you will be

data.title: Good Value
data.text: Not bad...nothing fancy but did the trick and in and around Denver it's about as good as you will get for the price.  They have decent rooms, offer an  evening social with food and drinks and a hot breakfast.   This is also a nice hotel in a good location for taking the light rail into Denver as the train is literally across the street.

data.title: Another Nice Drury Hotel
data.text: This is the third Drury Inn we have stayed in.  It is one of the smallest, but yet the service and amenities were top notch.  The room was clean and well appointed.  Kickstart was great and the breakfast was also very delicious.

data.title: Overnight Stay in Denver
data.text: For the most part our stay was fine. Whatever I have to complain about is just picky things. Overall, it's clean and the staff is friendly. You could tell our room was a former smoking room. I had to spray perfume. The free breakfast was just ok. Typical. We had a 1-bedroom suite. Bathroom was small. No vent in the bedroom so it didn't get as cool. Location was great - near the transit into downtown Denver. Highly recommend this! We stayed here because I had a free night stay; otherwise, I am not sure I"d choose it, but I would stay again -- and I'm pretty picky about my hotels.

data.title: overnight stay
data.text: Had a really good overnight stay at this Drury Was on our way to Kansas City Mo for a family reunion from Albuquerque NM Decided to spend the night and everyone was so kind and helpful as we had been traveling all day with the three dogs so we were ready for some good rest and swimming and dining They had such good evening food Was glad not to have to leave hotel. Thanks Drury as always.

data.title: Friendly and very helpful
data.text: Overall one of the best place to stay for a reasonable cost. From the front desk personal to the food prep and server to the mamagement all very interested in making sure your stay is a good one.  Yes I and my family will be staying there from now on .  Overall good rating.   Need anything.. Just ask them.

data.title: A great family hotel
data.text: Booked through Hotwire. There is nothing cheap in Denver. This hotel was excellant value for money. Free breakfast, and the hot food in the evening, on our first night it was spaghetti and meatballs. Not something I enjoy, but with a ton of kids it was great. Adults also get three drinks of beer or wine each night you stay. Free WiFi also. Rooms were a good size, this is an older style hotel, but well furnished with good beds for a good sleep. The rooms work well for a family like ours, two adults and two teenagers in the room. Plenty of space. Staff were young, (or am I just getting older) I find for the most part, younger staff are more willing to please, in a professional way, as was the case here. Centrally located.

data.title: Very Easy Access to Light Rail
data.text: The hotel is easily accessed from the "Dry Creek" rail station which is an easy ride from Union Station.  The hotel is located just across the street from the rail station.  We were greeted by a friendly front desk staff who did recognize that we were a Gold Key Club Member.  We were promptly offered a choice on room location and given our keys and told of the times for happy hour and breakfast.  The room was clean.  Happy hour offered the usual food items.  We enjoyed our drinks before heading out for the evening.  The parking lot is undergoing some construction and getting in and out of the parking lot can be tricky by car.  Breakfast was crowded but the food items were refreshed in a fair amount of time.  Check out went smoothly and we would come back again if in the area.  The rate for the room was great for the area.

data.title: HAPPILY SURPRISED
data.text:
We came to Denver to find my son & DIL a new home.  I came to help them look.  Needed a suite so they could have their privacy and the room worked exceptionally well.  The layout consist of a king size bed with a TV, telephone, many electrical outlets, separate AC & privacy door.  The main part of the room had a sofa bed which I used, a desk, several lamps, TV, mini fridge, microwave, AC, two sinks with a separate bath/toilet area.
The staff was exceptionally helpful on suggesting areas of Denver, directions & providing maps.  
The breakfast was delicious & hardy.  The 5:30pm dinner was also very filling with salad, two soup selections, bake potato bar, two different entrees, hot dogs with chili, chips with salsa & cheese.
As it turned out, we were too tired to go out to eat each day so the meals provided was a God Send.  Enjoyed the Adult Beverage too.  
All in all, great value for the stay in Denver.  I would highly recommend this hotel for it's location & service.

data.title: Outdated
data.text: This hotel was not as nice as other Drury Inns we have stayed at. The building seemed old and the amenities were maybe 2 star at the most. For over $100 per night I would expect more. The shower had soap, shampoo, and conditioner dispensers instead of the little bottles. No lotion at all. Towels were thin and scratchy. Breakfast area was small and crowded.

data.title: Great stay South of Denver
data.text:
Check in was a breeze, less than 5 minutes. There is construction in the parking area, however at the time we arrived we didn't have trouble finding a spot. Drury is our choice of hotel for their value. Free Parking, Free Wifi, Free Breakfast and Free Happy hour! For happy hour (5-7) they had salad, soup, hot dogs, nachos, pasta, popcorn, soda and 3 alcoholic beverages, all included with your stay!! The area to eat in was smaller in comparison to other Drurys. Service was phenomenal. Staff was constantly checking on us and making sure everything was clean.
Breakfast was good, eggs, biscuits, sausage, gravy, waffles, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, etc. There was plenty of food.
My kids liked the pool/ hot tub area. There was a pool, 1/2 indoor and then you could swim under a partition and be outside in the pool. 
Our room, 501, was a King Over sized suite. Essentially a king bedroom with door, a living area with pull out couch, separate sink area from toilet & shower. The toilet area was small & awkward. There were so many light switches and none of them made sense. Considering our room was facing I-25 and one whole wall was window, the sound was minimal. 
The bed was really comfortable and the room clean. 
It was close enough to everything without being in the middle of everything. We went to the Broncos training camp and into Denver. While traffic into Denver was a mess I'd rather stay here again than in Denver.

data.title: Family Vacation
data.text: This was our first time staying at a Drury Inn and we will stay more often. You felt like you were their only guest and that they appreciated your service to them. It was a great stay and we will stay again!

data.title: Will stay in Drury Inns again
data.text:
We're from the NorthEast and Drury Inns are in that area (please do!) and we've never stayed in a Drury Inn.  We had a great 1st experience.  The hotel was very clean, modern lobby.  Check-in took less than 5 minutes and all of the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly.  Happy hour was a nice touch and the breakfast was more than adequate.  There is a light rail station across the street which we used to go into Denver.  
Only issues we had were parking - there was construction in the front parking lot and the couch in the front room was very hard and uncomfortable.
